snippet: A reignited conflict over disputed territory continued into a second day of fighting, including aerial bombings.
abstract: Sudan and South Sudan continue to engage in direct military clashes and aerial bombardments in what the South describes as a 'limited war' that will continue indefinitely; South Sudanese military spokesman says fighting broke out near the town of Kersana as Sudanese armed forces advanced to try to retake the Heglig oil fields, which Sudan had controlled from 2005 until South Sudan captured them.
lead_paragraph: A reignited conflict over disputed territory continued into a second day of fighting, including aerial bombings.

headline.seo: Sudan and South Sudan Keep Up Attacks
headline.main: Sudan and South Sudan Keep Up Their Border Attacks
headline.print_headline: Sudan and South Sudan Keep Up Their Border Attacks
